review_content: Tastes really nice for for what it is. Clean lager very refreshing after a day of fishing. The older I get the more I seem to enjoy a cold lager on a warm day.
Halmgul och klar vätska med tunn skumslöja. Något sädig och lätt oren arom. Plastburkar är det första som far genom smaken. Söt och enkelspårig i utformningen.
Yeast and sweet malty aroma. Really light golden and clear. Taste is honey, malty, floral, but light on flavor. Gave me a killer head ache.
Oh god! What's this remind me of? Oh yes, the water that drifts down from binjo ditches after it rains and people puked in it in Kunsan. Trash!
Clear golden color and a white, quick dissapearing, head. Malty, grainy,   some sweetness and faint hoppy. Crisp.

Pours clear Golden with a thin white head. Aroma of acerbic grass. Taste has rich caramel malt, intensely grassy hop oils on a dry malt. Palate has lingering honey hint on the nose. Surprisingly good.

Clear gold colour, decent white head that swiftly shrinks. Very faint aroma, hay and lemon. Taste, malt and biscuit, sweet honey, something floral, almost no aftertaste. Ok, as far as mass market lagers go. Easy drinking, crisp, sweet, refreshing. Always enjoy the Thai dragon design on the label.
Pours a pale straw colour with soapy white coloured head.  Minimal aroma, but the taste is fresh and crisp as a lager should be.  Overall not a bad beer for this style.
Clear yellow, short white head. Almost no carbonation. Almost no smell and very light pilsner taste. A bit boring but refreshing when hot outside.

Aroma of mild malt
Yellow clear colour with little head
Taste of very mild malt
Almost no carbonation with watery mouthfeel

Żółto blade. Jak roztwór witaminy C. O pianie nie warto pisać. 
Prawie nie pachnie. Trochę słodem. 
Prawie bez smaku. Coś tam ze słodu, coś tam z goryczki. Ten pier…siarczyn czuć. 
Daj pan spokój.

0.33 bottle
C: clear amber
N: malt, shredded grain
P: highly malty, light acidity, sugary candy, very abrupt finish. Drinkable, but nothing exciting.
Słomkowe, klarowne piwo o dość obfitej pianie, która pozostaje do końca w formie mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat i smak nikły, słodowy. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie odczucia jak przy gazowanej wodzie.
Pustka, trochę kwiatów, zielone jabłuszko i mokry karton. Zero wrażeń, goryczki, słodyczy no czegokolwiek. W porównaniu z tym piwem to i rodzime koncerniaki smakują jak Hill Farmstead.

Butelka 04-11-20
Aromat: kwaśny, zielone jabłko 
Wygląd: jasnozłote, klarowne, piana ładna 
Smak: znów zielone jabłko, w sumie nic poza tym
Puste piwo, zdecydowanie zbyt orientalny smak piwa ;)
Tastes really nice for for what it is. Clean lager very refreshing after a day of fishing. The older I get the more I seem to enjoy a cold lager on a warm day.
Halmgul och klar vätska med tunn skumslöja. Något sädig och lätt oren arom. Plastburkar är det första som far genom smaken. Söt och enkelspårig i utformningen.
Yeast and sweet malty aroma. Really light golden and clear. Taste is honey, malty, floral, but light on flavor. Gave me a killer head ache.
Oh god! What's this remind me of? Oh yes, the water that drifts down from binjo ditches after it rains and people puked in it in Kunsan. Trash!
Clear golden color and a white, quick dissapearing, head. Malty, grainy,   some sweetness and faint hoppy. Crisp.

Pours clear Golden with a thin white head. Aroma of acerbic grass. Taste has rich caramel malt, intensely grassy hop oils on a dry malt. Palate has lingering honey hint on the nose. Surprisingly good.

Clear gold colour, decent white head that swiftly shrinks. Very faint aroma, hay and lemon. Taste, malt and biscuit, sweet honey, something floral, almost no aftertaste. Ok, as far as mass market lagers go. Easy drinking, crisp, sweet, refreshing. Always enjoy…
Pours a pale straw colour with soapy white coloured head.  Minimal aroma, but the taste is fresh and crisp as a lager should be.  Overall not a bad beer for this style.
Clear yellow, short white head. Almost no carbonation. Almost no smell and very light pilsner taste. A bit boring but refreshing when hot outside.
Aroma of mild malt Yellow clear colour with little head Taste of very mild malt…
Żółto blade. Jak roztwór witaminy C. O pianie nie warto pisać. Prawie nie pachnie. Trochę słodem. Prawie bez smaku. Coś tam ze słodu, coś tam z goryczki. Ten pier…siarczyn czu…
0.33 bottle C: clear amber N: malt, shredded grain…
Słomkowe, klarowne piwo o dość obfitej pianie, która pozostaje do końca w formie mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat i smak nikły, słodowy. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie odczucia jak przy gazowanej wodzie.
Pustka, trochę kwiatów, zielone jabłuszko i mokry karton. Zero wrażeń, goryczki, słodyczy no czegokolwiek. W porównaniu z tym piwem to i rodzime koncerniaki smakują jak Hill Farmstead.
Butelka 04-11-20 Aromat: kwaśny, zielone jabłko Wygląd: jasnozłote, klarowne, piana ładna…

33cl bottle from Malta. It is a good lager with low co2, but long lasting medium foam. Taste is also OK. Sweet malt, some smoke, some hop and hint of citric yeast. Surprisingly good in its own category.
[Butelka 07.05.2020] Barwa złota, klarowne. Piana średnia, średnio pęcherzykowa. Aromat i smak lagera, słodowo, niewielka goryczka. Nasycenie średnie.
Nice, easy to drink lager. Subtle citrusy aftertaste. Aroma grassy and fresh. Not incredibly challenging
Van tap bij Viva Aviv in Bangkok. Zoet, weeïg, ergens hoptonen, moutig, wat granig, licht klef. (8-12-2018).

light golden ale broasted corn with a malted broom straw and some light vegetation. a little sweet for balance and finishes short and watery after a touch of hop in the fizz. a bit of spring water type freshness.

W pierwszej nucie zadziwiająca nuta migdałowa. Później wychodzi typowa słodowość. 
W smaku słodowe, z nutami kwaskowymi. 
Nie smakuje jak typowy eurolager. 
Jest nawet trochę lepszy.
Wässrig herber Antrunk. Leicht getreidig, die Herbe bleibt konstant. Monoton, erfrischend aber langweilig. Mild würzig. Okay. 6/7/7/7//7
belle couleur blonde légèrement dorée. Col très mince et effemere. Belle effervescence. Gout quelconque.

On draught in Bangkok. Clear yellow with bright white head 1cm thick. Aroma of grass and hay. Tastes grassy but of fresh hops. Not too bad but ultimately too watery and tasteless. So good when really hot and thirsty.

On tap at the Bangkok airport. 
Aroma has a light malt character with light adjunct and a light hop character of floral and slightly fruity hops along with some grass. No diacetyl or sulfur. 
Pours a clear, very pale yellow gold with a small, moderately thick white head that recedes to a thin film that lingers. Faint lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is similar to the aroma, but with a slightly stronger adjunct character. Light bitterness an the hop character is more grassy than it was in the aroma. 
Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall pretty indistinguishable from the regular Singha. I suppose its slightly cleaner and has a better mouthfeel, but otherwise about the same. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light golden color with a thin head. Light hops and light bodied. Not overly flavorful.

Disons que j’ai bu cette bière parce que c’étais une bière de la Thaïlande. Elle ne fais pas vraiment changement des autres lager. Couleur blonde avec un léger col blanc. Gout de céréales sans gout complexes...
Tin.  Gold bubbly pour with thin fast dissipating head.  Faint beerlike aroma.  Oily body with a little hop in the flavour and finish.  Pas Op!

One of the more consistent beers of Thailand, I give it that......, but that just took the fun out of it! This produces up a well charged yellow gold with excellent clarity and a steady, cloud of foam atop. Aroma is mildly tinny in general from the can – this varies a lot from batch to batch. It is clean on draught with citric, sour and grassy hops and a good lot of dusty, straw-like grain coming through. Cereal-like malt dominates the relatively light palate. Racy in mouthfeel and crisp in the tail before a little hops and sour malt see it drop off shy. Not much else here really. A clean enough lager made for quaffing in the masses. Try on draught whenever possible. Good to quench the thirst in Thailand’s heat!
great beer very few head aches from drinking it in Thailand.This was by far my popular drink in Thailand al though this year in 2012 not as popular as Chang but still prefer Singha

Light golden coloured body with a thin white head. Aroma of pale malt, a touch of light hops and some very pungent cardboard. Light-bodied; Funky malt taste with a dry mellow taste and some light sweetness near the end. Aftertaste doesn’t show much, only a touch of malt with very little else. Overall, a fairly muted and mundane beer that doesn’t show much difference than the normal Singha - perhaps with a bit more mild flavour and some lighter bubbles. I sampled this 33 cL can purchased from 7-11 from central Bangkok on my honeymoon on 25-August-2009.
Same same but the ever so slightly bolder taste.  They’re big on the "Draught" versions over here...hilarious...

Pours pale golden with small shortlived fizzy white head. Aroma is barely noticeable, a little bit of malts and hops with some fruity notes. Watery crisp mouthfeel. Flavor is sweet, malty, hoppy and a bit grassy. Finishes short with light hoppy aftertaste.
On tap in Thailand. Poured clear yellow with white head. Aroma strong but not bad and flavor the same: hops and lemons. Better than an American Macro and good in the heat here.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with a white head.  Aroma of corn & malt. Sweet malty taste.

Bottled (Singha Premium Import Lager Beer)
 Pale golden with a fluffy head. Grainy aroma with some vague notes of cooked vegetables and hops. Flavour vise it starts off like an ordinary Pale Lager but then a biting hop bitterness shows up and kinda saves the day.

Bottled.  Pale golden colour, with low head. Vague grainy maltaroma with notes of cooked maize. Flavour is far better, grainy malty with suggestions of wood and hazelnuts. No sourness here. Still a bit flat in mouthfeel though. Very low on the bitterness, if any. Flavourwise ok for being a Pale Lager.
[i]Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget[/i]. Clear pale golden with a medium white head. Clean, neutral, weak and slightly sweet malt aroma, decent mouthfeel, low to moderate bitterness.
